meanings.definition: Tubifexes: small, reddish-brown aquatic worms commonly used as live food for fish.
meanings.sent1: The tubifexes wriggled in the water, attracting the hungry fish.
meanings.sent2: I bought some tubifexes to feed my pet fish.
meanings.sent3: The tubifexes had a party in the fish tank, but the fish were not invited.
meanings.sent4: The tubifexes danced gracefully in the aquarium, like underwater acrobats.
meanings.sent5: The tubifexes squirmed energetically, creating a lively underwater scene.

meanings.definition: Tubifexes: a group of tubular, segmented worms found in freshwater habitats.
meanings.sent1: A cluster of tubifexes was discovered in the clear stream.
meanings.sent2: The tubifexes burrowed deep into the muddy riverbed.
meanings.sent3: The tubifexes organized a race to see who could reach the other side of the pond first.
meanings.sent4: The tubifexes intertwined like a living puzzle in the creek.
meanings.sent5: The tubifexes wiggled together in harmony, creating a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: Tubifexes: the plural form of tubifex, referring to multiple individual worms.
meanings.sent1: I counted the tubifexes in the container to make sure I had enough for the fish.
meanings.sent2: The tubifexes squirmed in different directions, creating a chaotic scene.
meanings.sent3: The tubifexes formed a line, ready to jump into the fish tank.
meanings.sent4: The tubifexes resembled a moving carpet as they crawled across the aquarium floor.
meanings.sent5: The tubifexes multiplied rapidly, filling the tank with life.
